channel.title: Comments on: SSRS: How to monitor report subscriptions
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Anuj
item.dc:creator: Anuj
item.description: What does it mean when the LastStatus column has a value 'New Subscription'
item.content:encoded: What does it mean when the LastStatus column has a value ‘New Subscription’

item.title: By: Merc
item.dc:creator: Merc
item.description: be cautious when using '%error%' or '%errors%' in your where clause, as this can pick up successful runs with '%0 errors%'.
item.content:encoded: be cautious when using ‘%error%’ or ‘%errors%’ in your where clause, as this can pick up successful runs with ‘%0 errors%’.

item.title: By: Merc
item.dc:creator: Merc
item.content:encoded:
WHERE LastStatus LIKE ‘%The subscription contains parameter values that are not valid.%’
OR LastStatus LIKE ‘%Error:%’
OR LastStatus LIKE ‘%Failure%’
OR LastStatus LIKE ‘%The e-mail address of one or more recipients is not valid.%’
OR (LastStatus like ‘%; % errors.’ and LastStatus not like ‘%; 0 errors.’)

item.title: By: Trivz
item.dc:creator: Trivz
item.description: Use LastStatus NOT LIKE 'Mail sent%'. that should give you a list of all subscriptions with an error. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: Use LastStatus NOT LIKE ‘Mail sent%’. that should give you a list of all subscriptions with an error. Thanks.

item.title: By: Fred Stimler
item.dc:creator: Fred Stimler
item.description: Did you ever find out the possible values of Subscriptions.LastStatus? I am doing a report on my subscription reports and I have to know what is in this field, even during the operation of the report processing. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: Did you ever find out the possible values of Subscriptions.LastStatus? I am doing a report on my subscription reports and I have to know what is in this field, even during the operation of the report processing. Thanks.
